intro: Neoporteria melanacantha, commonly known as the black-stemmed star-of-Bethlehem, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers. The leaves are linear and often have a dark green color with a slightly waxy texture. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or containers. It is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
